Movie details:

YEAR:1940  
RUNNING TIME: 93 min.
COUNTRY:United States
DIRECTOR: Rouben Mamoulian

CINEMATOGRAPHER: Arthur Miller (B&W)
CAST: Tyrone Power, Linda Darnell, Basil Rathbone, Gale 
Sondergaard, Eugene Pallette, J. Edward Bromberg
STUDIO/PRODUCER: 20th Century Fox
GENRE: Adventure


Synopsis:

Around 1820 the son of a California nobleman comes home from Spain to find his 
native land under a villainous dictatorship. On the one hand he plays the 
useless fop, while on the other he is the masked avenger Zorro.  Written by Ed

Trivia:

    * The original working title for this film was "The Californian".

    * During filming, &#039;Tyrone Power (I)&#039; was in the habit of taking an early 
morning swim in a pool that he insisted on being carefully pre-heated. Darryl F. 
Zanuck played a prank on him by arranging for the heating to be turned off. 
Power dived in and got such a shock that he later claimed he nearly had a heart 
attack. He got his revenge. Zanuck watched the dailies every day with a critical 
eye and one evening saw something unexpected; the cast and crew collaborated to 
film a spoof version of the hold-up scene where Zorro robs a coach carrying the 
Governor and his wife. When Zorro is supposed to slash his Z into the vehicle&#039;s 
upholstery, the camera reveals he has slashed "DZ". "Oh my God, it&#039;s Zanuck" his 
victims gasp. Power responds: "That&#039;s right, you bastards..." and describes the 
producer in very unflattering language.

    * In DC comic lore, this version of Zorro with &#039;Tyrone Power (I)&#039; is the 
movie that a young Bruce Wayne goes to see the night his parents are mugged and 
shot by Joe Chill. After coming out of the movie and walking through an alley 
with Bruce is when they are mugged, and what leads to Batman&#039;s creation. This 
fact is mentioned in the 1986 Frank Miller comic The Dark Knight Returns.

    * Like most of the actors who portrayed Zorro at around this time, &#039;Tyrone 
Power (I)&#039; was not of Hispanic heritage (he was of British descent).

    * Basil Rathbone, being a well known fencer in his own right, was asked how 
well &#039;Tyrone Power (I)&#039; did in their scenes in which stunt doubles were not 
used. Rathbone responded, " Tyrone Power could fence Errol Flynn into a box!"
